newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends firmer in quiet market.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends firmer in quiet market.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka closed slightly firmer at 42.30/42.38 to the dollar in quiet interbank trading against the opening rates at 42.30/42/40, dealers said.

Dealers said the taka was quoted lower at the opening after the central bank readjusted the currency downwards at 42.20.42.40 from 42.02/42.25 against the dollar effective on Saturday. Friday is a holiday in Moslem Bangladesh.
Dealers said the interbank call money rates closed at 4.25 percent to 5.0 percent against the previous 4.5-5.25 percent.
